page.title: 08FULBOURN HOSPITAL - cont.
page.content: 8.30am. I arrive at the Drinks Problem Unit, Fulbourn Hospital, and unlock doors, check the patients are OK, and give medication if necessary. 9.00 Staff meeting and cup of tea. 9.30-10.15 Community Meeting. Everyone at the Unit, staff as well as patients, sits round in a circle to share common or individual problems. After this, each morning is different, with perhaps new patients to admit, or smaller group work. After lunch I may see some patients on their own, or counsel spouses of patients. Visiting hours are flexible- people can come at any time group sessions are not on. 5.30 pm. I lock up and go home. It is a long day; sometimes the patients can be angry or violent (there is a punch-ball for them to vent their anger on), but I enjoy it.
